intro: Ocimum formosum, commonly known as the sacred basil or holy basil, is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. It is native to tropical regions of Asia and is widely cultivated for its fragrant foliage and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually violet or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem. Ocimum formosum is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects.
